title.value: Robust Policy Learning over Multiple Uncertainty Sets
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning and throughout the paper, along with the authors' names.
title.quote:
Robust Policy Learning over Multiple Uncertainty Sets

Annie Xie ^{1} Shagun Sodhani ^{2} Chelsea Finn ^{1} Joelle Pineau ^{2} Amy Zhang ^{2}

extractions.description: The paper addresses the challenge of developing reinforcement learning (RL) agents that are robust to variations in safety-critical environments. It introduces the concept of a multi-set robustness problem, aiming to learn a policy that is robust to multiple uncertainty sets. The proposed approach combines elements of system identification and robust RL, referred to as System Identification and Risk-Sensitive Adaptation (SIRSA). The paper compares this method with existing techniques, showing its effectiveness in improving worst-case performance across diverse control tasks.

type.justification: The paper presents experiments and comparisons of the proposed method (SIRSA) against other baselines in practice across various control tasks.
type.quote: We design several experiments to understand the effectiveness of our proposed approach compared to system identification and robust RL approaches in unseen environments.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on improving reinforcement learning methods to handle uncertainties in multiple environments.
name.quote: Uncertainty is a prevalent challenge in most realistic reinforcement learning (RL) settings. Our work studies the uncertainty that arises when an agent is transferred to a new environment...

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses robust RL by aiming to learn policies that work well under worst-case scenarios across multiple uncertainty sets.
name.quote: Robust RL is one of the primary approaches to this problem as it aims to learn a policy that performs well under worst-case perturbations to the context...

name.justification: The proposed method seeks to generalize robust policies across multiple tasks or environments, which aligns with multi-task learning approaches.
name.quote: The robust, multi-task, and multi-set robust RL setups...Multi-set robust RL aims to learn a policy that performs well with respect to a collection of uncertainty sets.

name.justification: The paper uses system identification to reduce uncertainties in parameters, which is a core part of the proposed SIRSA method.
name.quote: To this end, we formulate the multi-set robustness problem to learn a policy that is robust to multiple uncertainty sets. We then propose a framework that consists of a probabilistic system identification model...

name.justification: The paper introduces a new model called SIRSA, which is a key contribution of the work.
name.quote: We call our approach System Identification and Risk-Sensitive Adaptation (SIRSA).

is_contributed.justification: SIRSA is presented as a novel approach introduced by the authors as a solution to the problem of robust policy learning over multiple uncertainty sets.
is_contributed.quote: We then propose a framework that consists of a probabilistic system identification model and our multi-set robust policy...We call our approach System Identification and Risk-Sensitive Adaptation (SIRSA).

is_executed.justification: The paper provides details on experiments using SIRSA across various tasks demonstrating its execution.
is_executed.quote: We design several experiments to understand the effectiveness of our proposed approach compared to system identification and robust RL approaches in unseen environments.

is_compared.justification: SIRSA is compared with other robust RL techniques and system identification methods as part of the experiments section in the paper.
is_compared.quote: We compare SIRSA to prior methods based on robust RL and on system identification on a suite of continuous control tasks...

referenced_paper_title.justification: SIRSA is a novel contribution by the authors in this paper itself, hence no prior reference paper is applicable.
